messages.title: Carole Whitty: Speaking Up for Our Constituency
It is a huge privilege to stand for Labour values in the constituency that I love.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will build economic partnerships to encourage premium job opportunities and a vibrant community.
Committed to expanding transport with affordable fares and Labour's plan of an integrated transport system.
I will campaign for desperately needed affordable housing to reflect high sustainability standards.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Cut Fuel Bills and Our Carbon Footprint
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Goal is support for individuals, communities and trade and industry to cut fuel bills and our carbon footprint.
Will champion the role of state schools, hospitals, and other public services and ensure resilience and quality.

issues.education: Labour Achievements in Totnes, Investment in Education
issues.environment: Cut Fuel Bills and Our Carbon Footprint

leaflet.personalStatement: It is a huge privilege to stand for Labour values in the constituency that I love; I have lived here for the last 19 years with my husband, Tony, the Mayor elect of Totnes. We have two children. Everything I do is underpinned by a deep belief in the development of strong, resilient communities and social inclusiveness. I am proud to have worked with young people throughout my career and have been the Headteacher of two large comprehensive schools and therefore know the importance of building cooperation and mutual respect across the generations.

politicalExperience.achievements: Worked at two large comprehensive schools.

endorsements.endorser: David Horsburgh, Local Resident and Councillor
endorsements.endorsement: Carole Whitty is an exceptionally strong candidate, passionate, articulate, a community campaigner, good at building parliamentary partnerships and full of commonsense... will leave no stone unturned for an answer.

images.caption: Carole with Henry Blen, pressing the case for rural investment
